alternatives.transcript: with energy costs rocketing in the 1970s and 80s building designers and operators rearrange their priorities outside air was now to be kept outside an open window represented a heat loss so more and more buildings were now to be designed as airtight envelopes and this coincided with two other fundamental changes over those same 20 years an increased Reliance on synthetic building and Furnishing materials along with an increase in the number of hours people were spending indoors

has a mounting in fact to more than 90 percent of their time spent at home at work or in some form of transportation between the two no wonder then that were forced to pay more attention today to the quality of our indoor air in fact we ourselves are affecting this quality all the time with substances from cleaning agents waxes and solvents from particle board wall coverings paint phone carpets vinyl and rubber flooring disinfectants and room fresheners and dozens of other elements that go

under the construction and Furnishing of a building and by our activities such as copying printing duplicating cooking cleaning and simply by living and breathing for we ourselves are constantly giving off bacteria and skin scales carbon dioxide and fumes from dry cleaning deodorants perfumes and hair sprays then tobacco smoke to is seen by many people as a contributor to the mix however it's interesting to note the findings of several major studies on this point more than 50% of the

he's investigated had inadequate or poor ventilation systems whereas in only two to four percent of cases in which building occupants complained of sick building syndrome with a complaints ultimately associated with tobacco smoke and if ventilation and air filtration are inadequate it follows that those substances many of which can cause discomfort will not be adequately removed or diluted and if air conditioning units are badly designed or maintained as well stagnant water May collect in which microorganisms can flourish

then the very air handling system which is meant to provide fresh air may also be delivering bacterial and fungal spores however a well designed and maintained HV AC system is integral to providing acceptable indoor air quality a conventional hvdc system introduces the are usually it's ceiling level heated cooled humidified or dehumidified as required to mix with the are already in the room used are as then exhausted through ceilings

grills an interesting alternative to this used for some years in Scandinavia in Europe and in US industry as well is the displacement ventilation method which introduces are at the base of the walls or up through the floor as air rises it speeds the natural upward flow of the warmed are already in the room and is then exhausted through ceiling grills this was the technology Philip Morris Engineers used in 1992 develop the fact system filtered air

all technology fact combines existing hva see Technologies and components to supply and even upward flow of filtered air which can improve air quality in a variety of situations it is proven effective in high-density smoking environments with fact the used air can be exhausted directly outside or else partially recirculated mixing with new air from outside passing through an electronic air cleaner which removes most particulates then through an acid treated

dated carbon filter to remove gaseous components then the filtered air passes over heating and cooling coils and is sped by a constant volume blower into a main Supply Air Duct then through smaller Branch ducks in the underfloor plenum and up through perforations in the raised steel floor the floor is covered with standard commercial grade woven carpet but with its backing modified to allow air to flow through it and a simple test with a sheet of paper shows just how well it flows providing a cushion

the Veyron which the paper floats easily since the air is supplied at 68 degrees fact does not create any sensation of draft on ankles and legs its flow rate can be adjusted to a rooms occupancy and use and can change its are completely in two to four minutes this means that the Airborne substances by which we affect our indoor environment dust dirt skin scales tobacco smoke bacteria and so on will rise vertically above the room occupants and be removed

and into the exhaust located in the ceiling since most emissions from human activity are usually warmer than the surrounding air they'll naturally move upwards on thermal currents the upward flow of the fact system simply speeds up that process to show how the fact system performed against the realities of commercial use it was installed in a 660 square foot Patron Lounge as part of the renovation of the Benetton Center for Performing Arts in Pittsburgh Pennsylvania the lounge is used for intermission

and accommodates both smokers and non-smokers this application employs an air handling system which recycles 50% of the room air mixes it with new outside air prior to filtration then a constant volume of treated air moves upwards through the lounge at a rate of 10 feet per minute so that the room air is completely replaced every 2 minutes to evaluate the system are samples were taken outside the building in the lobby next to the lounge at floor level breathing Zone level and ceiling level at the

front center and rear of the lounge during various periods when it was in use the results reported year were from the samples taken at the center of the lounge at breathing Zone level and the occupancy periods were with two people present not smoking 25 people present not smoking 33 people most smoking and extremely high smoking density here with 44 cigarettes into cigars being smoked in total and finally with three people left after everyone else had gone now with no smoking the team

measure temperature relative humidity find us call respirable suspended particles formaldehyde nicotine carbon monoxide carbon dioxide and microbial counts temperatures in the room range from 60 seven point eight to seventy two point six degrees Fahrenheit relative humidity readings inside were maintained between 42 and 48.5% rsps were 50 micrograms per cubic meter in the outside air and much lower in the lounge the formaldehyde

levels were consistently below the minimum detection limit of 0.03 parts per million nicotine was less than 0.6 6 micrograms per cubic meter in every sample taken except in the high-density smoking period when it was 13.6 and the final period when it fell back down to 0.80 within minutes of the lounge being empty carbon monoxide measured two parts per million throughout the trial except for the period of high smoking activity when it increased to three parts

per million not surprisingly the CO2 levels changed in line with the number of people present starting at 350 parts per million peaking at 500 when the room was crowded and falling to 400 when it emptied colony-forming units of microorganisms range from a high of 701 in the outside air down to 96 in the lounge no pathogenic organisms were found

this has been the story of just one fact success there will be more for the possibilities of this remarkable development are endless for conference rooms airport and train terminal lounges shopping malls restaurants museums theaters movie houses and designated smoking areas we're using energy efficient techniques and designing our buildings more synthetics to construct and furnish them for reducing the amount of air to ventilate them and then we're spending a whole lot more of our lives in them

so really effective ventilation becomes more and more important and that's why we are constantly evaluating new products and Technologies seeking out new ways to improve the quality of our indoor air if you'd like to be kept informed of these developments or if you'd like more details on the fact system call toll-free in the United States one 898 fact system is working fine for us and we're very pleased with it and so our patrons they find
this atmosphere very comfortable and enjoy being in this environment and when you come to performances they look for the space and do spend time here
